content: This started from Vlad's comment on the search PR here

Tim Abbott had two concerns that he posted in #26158:

(1) Changing "No search results." to not have the period "No search results"

I don't think this string change is an intentional design change; Vlad's designs generally don't aim to perfectly transcribe strings.

(2) Removing the display of what was searched for

Am I correct that this is removing our display of stop words that you searched for? That's an important feature to avoid search results being confusing that I suspect @terpimost was not aware of; I don't think removing that feature is an intentional design choice here.
@Vlad Korobov would love to hear your thoughts on these issues

My personal opinions are

(1) I don't have strong preferences about periods, but if we remove them for phrases that aren't full sentences then it would be good to do that more widely

(2) I don't have a good understanding of why we want to show the words if they're in the search bar, but maybe I'm missing some understanding of how this feature works.

From the mention of "stop words", I think it's about this behavior: image.png

where it lets the user know that the word "the" was dropped from the search.

(I'm not coming up with an example right now where that would explain to the user why they got fewer results than they expected, though.)

I was not aware about "stop words"... I don't think that current message is the best way to go about it, since it isn't telling user how to include the whole phrase in search for exact match.

No dot in a header is intentional, because it is not a sentence and in general headers don't have dots.

But there are many things I don't understand about Zulip's search UX, so I suggest to move on right now...
So I'll close the PR for now and we'll come back to it later?
